'''''Conocybe tenera''''' is a widely distributed member of the genus ''[[Conocybe]]''.  This mushroom is the [[type species]] for the [[Conocybe|genus ''Conocybe'']].

==Description==
''Conocybe tenera'' is a small [[saprotrophic]] [[mushroom]] with a [[conic]] to [[wikt:convex|convex]] cap and is smooth and colored cinnamon brown.  It is usually less than 2 cm across and is striate almost to the center.   The gills are [[wikt:adnate|adnate]] and colored pale brown, darkening in age.   The [[spores]] are yellowish brown, smooth and [[ellipsoid]] with a [[germ pore]], measuring 12 x 6 micrometres.  The stem is 3 to 9 cm long, 1.5 mm thick, and is equal width for the whole length, sometimes with some swelling at the base.  It lacks an [[Annulus (mycology)|annulus]] (ring), is hollow and [[wikt:pruinose|pruinose]] near the top.

==Distribution and habitat==

Widely distributed across the world.  Found in meadows and cities.

==Edibility==

Poisonous, This agaric might contain toxins which could prove fatal.

==References==

* Mushroom Observer - Conocybe Tenera [https://mushroomobserver.org/409]
